properties.name: zk_pid_file

properties.name: zk_user

properties.description: Path to domain socket.
properties.name: dfs.domain.socket.path

properties.description:
Specifies the combined maximum allowed size of a KeyValue
    instance. This is to set an upper boundary for a single entry saved in a
    storage file. Since they cannot be split it helps avoiding that a region
    cannot be split any further because the data is too large. It seems wise
    to set this to a fraction of the maximum region size. Setting it to zero
    or less disables the check.
properties.name: hbase.client.keyvalue.maxsize

properties.description:
Number of rows that will be fetched when calling next
    on a scanner if it is not served from (local,client) memory. Higher
    caching values will enable faster scanners but will eat up more memory
    and some calls of next may take longer and longer times when the cache is empty.
    Do not set this value such that the time between invocations is greater
    than the scanner timeout; i.e. hbase.regionserver.lease.period
properties.name: hbase.client.scanner.caching

properties.description:
The mode the cluster will be in. Possible values are
      false for standalone mode and true for distributed mode.  If
      false,startup will run all HBase and ZooKeeper daemons together
      in the one JVM.
properties.name: hbase.cluster.distributed

properties.description: Disables version verification.
properties.name: hbase.defaults.for.version.skip

properties.description:
The time (in milliseconds) between 'major' compactions of all
    HStoreFiles in a region.  Default: 1 day.
    Set to 0 to disable automated major compactions.
properties.name: hbase.hregion.majorcompaction

properties.description:
Maximum HStoreFile size. If any one of a column families' HStoreFiles has
    grown to exceed this value,the hosting HRegion is split in two.
    Default: 1G.
properties.name: hbase.hregion.max.filesize

properties.description:
Block updates if memstore has hbase.hregion.memstore.block.multiplier
    time hbase.hregion.flush.size bytes.  Useful preventing
    runaway memstore during spikes in update traffic.  Without an
    upper-bound,memstore fills such that when it flushes the
    resultant flush files take a long time to compact or split,or
    worse,we OOME
properties.name: hbase.hregion.memstore.block.multiplier

properties.description:
Memstore will be flushed to disk if size of the memstore
    exceeds this number of bytes.  Value is checked by a thread that runs
    every hbase.server.thread.wakefrequency.
properties.name: hbase.hregion.memstore.flush.size

properties.description:
Enables the MemStore-Local Allocation Buffer,
      a feature which works to prevent heap fragmentation under
      heavy write loads. This can reduce the frequency of stop-the-world
      GC pauses on large heaps.
properties.name: hbase.hregion.memstore.mslab.enabled

properties.description:
If more than this number of StoreFiles in any one Store
    (one StoreFile is written per flush of MemStore) then updates are
    blocked for this HRegion until a compaction is completed,or
    until hbase.hstore.blockingWaitTime has been exceeded.
properties.name: hbase.hstore.blockingStoreFiles

properties.description:
If more than this number of HStoreFiles in any one HStore
    (one HStoreFile is written per flush of memstore) then a compaction
    is run to rewrite all HStoreFiles files as one.  Larger numbers
    put off compaction but when it runs,it takes longer to complete.
properties.name: hbase.hstore.compactionThreshold

properties.description: The number of times the region flush operation will be retried.
properties.name: hbase.hstore.flush.retries.number

properties.description:
When memstores are being forced to flush to make room in
      memory,keep flushing until we hit this mark. Defaults to 35% of heap.
      This value equal to hbase.regionserver.global.memstore.upperLimit causes
      the minimum possible flushing to occur when updates are blocked due to
      memstore limiting.
properties.name: hbase.regionserver.global.memstore.lowerLimit

properties.description:
Maximum size of all memstores in a region server before new
      updates are blocked and flushes are forced. Defaults to 40% of heap
properties.name: hbase.regionserver.global.memstore.upperLimit

properties.description:
Count of RPC Listener instances spun up on RegionServers.
    Same property is used by the Master for count of master handlers.
    Default is 10.
properties.name: hbase.regionserver.handler.count

properties.description:
The directory shared by region servers and into
    which HBase persists.  The URL should be 'fully-qualified'
    to include the filesystem scheme.  For example,to specify the
    HDFS directory '/hbase' where the HDFS instance's namenode is
    running at namenode.example.org on port 9000,set this value to:
    hdfs://namenode.example.org:9000/hbase.  By default HBase writes
    into /tmp.  Change this configuration else all data will be lost
    on machine restart.
properties.name: hbase.rootdir

properties.description: Enables HBase authorization. Set the value of this property to false to disable HBase authorization.
properties.name: hbase.security.authorization

properties.description:
List of users or groups (comma-separated),who are allowed
    full privileges,regardless of stored ACLs,across the cluster.
    Only used when HBase security is enabled.
properties.name: hbase.superuser

properties.description:
Temporary directory on the local filesystem.
    Change this setting to point to a location more permanent
    than '/tmp' (The '/tmp' directory is often cleared on
    machine restart).
properties.name: hbase.tmp.dir

properties.description:
Property from ZooKeeper's config zoo.cfg.
    The port at which the clients will connect.
properties.name: hbase.zookeeper.property.clientPort

properties.description:
Comma separated list of servers in the ZooKeeper Quorum.
    For example,"host1.mydomain.com,host2.mydomain.com,host3.mydomain.com".
    By default this is set to localhost for local and pseudo-distributed modes
    of operation. For a fully-distributed setup,this should be set to a full
    list of ZooKeeper quorum servers. If HBASE_MANAGES_ZK is set in hbase-env.sh
    this is the list of servers which we will start/stop ZooKeeper on.
properties.name: hbase.zookeeper.quorum

properties.description:
Instructs HBase to make use of ZooKeeper's multi-update functionality.
    This allows certain ZooKeeper operations to complete more quickly and prevents some issues
    with rare Replication failure scenarios (see the release note of HBASE-2611 for an example).·
    IMPORTANT: only set this to true if all ZooKeeper servers in the cluster are on version 3.4+
    and will not be downgraded.  ZooKeeper versions before 3.4 do not support multi-update and will
    not fail gracefully if multi-update is invoked (see ZOOKEEPER-1495).
properties.name: hbase.zookeeper.useMulti

properties.description:
Percentage of maximum heap (-Xmx setting) to allocate to block cache
        used by HFile/StoreFile. Default of 0.25 means allocate 25%.
        Set to 0 to disable but it's not recommended.
properties.name: hfile.block.cache.size

properties.description:
ZooKeeper session timeout.
      HBase passes this to the zk quorum as suggested maximum time for a
      session (This setting becomes zookeeper's 'maxSessionTimeout').  See
      http://hadoop.apache.org/zookeeper/docs/current/zookeeperProgrammers.html#ch_zkSessions
      "The client sends a requested timeout,the server responds with the
      timeout that it can give the client. " In milliseconds.
properties.name: zookeeper.session.timeout

properties.description:
Root ZNode for HBase in ZooKeeper. All of HBase's ZooKeeper
      files that are configured with a relative path will go under this node.
      By default,all of HBase's ZooKeeper file path are configured with a
      relative path,so they will all go under this directory unless changed.
properties.name: zookeeper.znode.parent

properties.description:
ACL for HMasterInterface protocol implementation (ie. 
    clients talking to HMaster for admin operations).
    The ACL is a comma-separated list of user and group names. The user and 
    group list is separated by a blank. For e.g. "alice,bob users,wheel". 
    A special value of "*" means all users are allowed.
properties.name: security.admin.protocol.acl

properties.description:
ACL for HMasterRegionInterface protocol implementations
    (for HRegionServers communicating with HMaster)
    The ACL is a comma-separated list of user and group names. The user and 
    group list is separated by a blank. For e.g. "alice,bob users,wheel". 
    A special value of "*" means all users are allowed.
properties.name: security.masterregion.protocol.acl

properties.description:
If "true",access tokens are used as capabilities for accessing datanodes.
If "false",no access tokens are checked on accessing datanodes.
properties.name: dfs.block.access.token.enable

properties.description: Delay for first block report in seconds.
properties.name: dfs.blockreport.initialDelay

properties.description: The default block size for new files.
properties.name: dfs.blocksize

properties.description: This configuration parameter turns on short-circuit local reads.
properties.name: dfs.client.read.shortcircuit

properties.description:
The DFSClient maintains a cache of recently opened file descriptors. This
      parameter controls the size of that cache. Setting this higher will use
      more file descriptors,but potentially provide better performance on
      workloads involving lots of seeks.
properties.name: dfs.client.read.shortcircuit.streams.cache.size

properties.description: ACL for who all can view the default servlets in the HDFS
properties.name: dfs.cluster.administrators

properties.description:
Specifies the maximum amount of bandwidth that each datanode
        can utilize for the balancing purpose in term of
        the number of bytes per second.
properties.name: dfs.datanode.balance.bandwidthPerSec

properties.description:
The permissions that should be there on dfs.datanode.data.dir
directories. The datanode will not come up if the permissions are
different on existing dfs.datanode.data.dir directories. If the directories
don't exist,they will be created with this permission.
properties.name: dfs.datanode.data.dir.perm

properties.description: Reserved space in bytes per volume. Always leave this much space free for non dfs use.
properties.name: dfs.datanode.du.reserved

properties.description: #of failed disks dn would tolerate
properties.name: dfs.datanode.failed.volumes.tolerated

properties.description:
The datanode ipc server address and port.
If the port is 0 then the server will start on a free port.
properties.name: dfs.datanode.ipc.address

properties.description: PRIVATE CONFIG VARIABLE
properties.name: dfs.datanode.max.transfer.threads

properties.description: Determines datanode heartbeat interval in seconds.
properties.name: dfs.heartbeat.interval

properties.description: This property is used by HftpFileSystem.
properties.name: dfs.https.port

properties.description: The path where the JournalNode daemon will store its local state.
properties.name: dfs.journalnode.edits.dir

properties.description:
The address and port the JournalNode web UI listens on.
     If the port is 0 then the server will start on a free port.
properties.name: dfs.journalnode.http-address

properties.description:
The access time for HDFS file is precise upto this value.
                 The default value is 1 hour. Setting a value of 0 disables
                 access times for HDFS.
properties.name: dfs.namenode.accesstime.precision

properties.description:
Indicate whether or not to avoid reading from stale datanodes whose
      heartbeat messages have not been received by the namenode for more than a
      specified time interval.
properties.name: dfs.namenode.avoid.read.stale.datanode

properties.description:
Indicate whether or not to avoid writing to stale datanodes whose
      heartbeat messages have not been received by the namenode for more than a
      specified time interval.
properties.name: dfs.namenode.avoid.write.stale.datanode

properties.description:
Determines where on the local filesystem the DFS secondary
      name node should store the temporary edits to merge.
      If this is a comma-delimited list of directoires then teh edits is
      replicated in all of the directoires for redundancy.
      Default value is same as dfs.namenode.checkpoint.dir
properties.name: dfs.namenode.checkpoint.edits.dir

properties.description: Added to grow Queue size so that more client connections are allowed
properties.name: dfs.namenode.handler.count

properties.description:
Specifies the percentage of blocks that should satisfy
        the minimal replication requirement defined by dfs.namenode.replication.min.
        Values less than or equal to 0 mean not to start in safe mode.
        Values greater than 1 will make safe mode permanent.
properties.name: dfs.namenode.safemode.threshold-pct

properties.description: Datanode is stale after not getting a heartbeat in this interval in ms
properties.name: dfs.namenode.stale.datanode.interval

properties.description:
When the ratio of number stale datanodes to total datanodes marked is greater
      than this ratio,stop avoiding writing to stale nodes so as to prevent causing hotspots.
properties.name: dfs.namenode.write.stale.datanode.ratio

properties.description:
If "true",enable permission checking in HDFS.
If "false",permission checking is turned off,
but all other behavior is unchanged.
Switching from one parameter value to the other does not change the mode,
owner or group of files or directories.
properties.name: dfs.permissions.enabled

properties.description: The name of the group of super-users.
properties.name: dfs.permissions.superusergroup

properties.description: Default block replication.
properties.name: dfs.replication

properties.description: Maximal block replication.
properties.name: dfs.replication.max

properties.description: to enable dfs append
properties.name: dfs.support.append

properties.description: to enable webhdfs
properties.name: dfs.webhdfs.enabled

properties.description: The octal umask used when creating files and directories.
properties.name: fs.permissions.umask-mode

properties.description:
Number of minutes between trash checkpoints.
  If zero,the trash feature is disabled.
properties.name: fs.trash.interval

properties.description:
The mapping from kerberos principal names to local OS mapreduce.job.user.names.
  So the default rule is just "DEFAULT" which takes all principals in your default domain to their first component.
  "omalley@APACHE.ORG" and "omalley/admin@APACHE.ORG" to "omalley",if your default domain is APACHE.ORG.
The translations rules have 3 sections:
      base     filter    substitution
The base consists of a number that represents the number of components in the principal name excluding the realm and the pattern for building the name from the sections of the principal name. The base uses $0 to mean the realm,$1 to mean the first component and $2 to mean the second component.

[1:$1@$0] translates "omalley@APACHE.ORG" to "omalley@APACHE.ORG"
[2:$1] translates "omalley/admin@APACHE.ORG" to "omalley"
[2:$1%$2] translates "omalley/admin@APACHE.ORG" to "omalley%admin"

The filter is a regex in parens that must the generated string for the rule to apply.

"(.*%admin)" will take any string that ends in "%admin"
"(.*@ACME.COM)" will take any string that ends in "@ACME.COM"

Finally,the substitution is a sed rule to translate a regex into a fixed string.

"s/@ACME\.COM//" removes the first instance of "@ACME.COM".
"s/@[A-Z]*\.COM//" removes the first instance of "@" followed by a name followed by ".COM".
"s/X/Y/g" replaces all of the "X" in the name with "Y"

So,if your default realm was APACHE.ORG,but you also wanted to take all principals from ACME.COM that had a single component "joe@ACME.COM",you'd do:

RULE:[1:$1@$0](.@ACME.ORG)s/@.//
DEFAULT

To also translate the names with a second component,you'd make the rules:

RULE:[1:$1@$0](.@ACME.ORG)s/@.//
RULE:[2:$1@$0](.@ACME.ORG)s/@.//
DEFAULT

If you want to treat all principals from APACHE.ORG with /admin as "admin",your rules would look like:

RULE[2:$1%$2@$0](.%admin@APACHE.ORG)s/./admin/
DEFAULT
properties.name: hadoop.security.auth_to_local

properties.description:
Set the authentication for the cluster. Valid values are: simple or
   kerberos.
properties.name: hadoop.security.authentication

properties.description: Enable authorization for different protocols.
properties.name: hadoop.security.authorization

properties.description:
A list of the compression codec classes that can be used
                 for compression/decompression.
properties.name: io.compression.codecs

properties.description:
The size of buffer for use in sequence files.
  The size of this buffer should probably be a multiple of hardware
  page size (4096 on Intel x86),and it determines how much data is
  buffered during read and write operations.
properties.name: io.file.buffer.size

properties.description: Defines the maximum number of retries for IPC connections.
properties.name: ipc.client.connect.max.retries

properties.description:
The maximum time after which a client will bring down the
               connection to the server.
properties.name: ipc.client.connection.maxidletime

properties.description:
Defines the threshold number of connections after which
               connections will be inspected for idleness.
properties.name: ipc.client.idlethreshold

properties.description:
If set to true,the web interfaces of JT and NN may contain
                actions,such as kill job,delete file,etc.,that should
                not be exposed to public. Enable this option if the interfaces
                are only reachable by those who have the right authorization.
properties.name: mapreduce.jobtracker.webinterface.trusted

properties.description:
ACL for AdminOperationsProtocol. Used for admin commands.
    The ACL is a comma-separated list of user and group names. The user and
    group list is separated by a blank. For e.g. "alice,bob users,wheel".
    A special value of "*" means all users are allowed.
properties.name: security.admin.operations.protocol.acl

properties.description:
ACL for ClientDatanodeProtocol,the client-to-datanode protocol
    for block recovery.
    The ACL is a comma-separated list of user and group names. The user and
    group list is separated by a blank. For e.g. "alice,bob users,wheel".
    A special value of "*" means all users are allowed.
properties.name: security.client.datanode.protocol.acl

properties.description:
ACL for ClientProtocol,which is used by user code
    via the DistributedFileSystem.
    The ACL is a comma-separated list of user and group names. The user and
    group list is separated by a blank. For e.g. "alice,bob users,wheel".
    A special value of "*" means all users are allowed.
properties.name: security.client.protocol.acl

properties.description:
ACL for DatanodeProtocol,which is used by datanodes to
    communicate with the namenode.
    The ACL is a comma-separated list of user and group names. The user and
    group list is separated by a blank. For e.g. "alice,bob users,wheel".
    A special value of "*" means all users are allowed.
properties.name: security.datanode.protocol.acl

properties.description:
ACL for InterDatanodeProtocol,the inter-datanode protocol
    for updating generation timestamp.
    The ACL is a comma-separated list of user and group names. The user and
    group list is separated by a blank. For e.g. "alice,bob users,wheel".
    A special value of "*" means all users are allowed.
properties.name: security.inter.datanode.protocol.acl

properties.description:
ACL for InterTrackerProtocol,used by the tasktrackers to
    communicate with the jobtracker.
    The ACL is a comma-separated list of user and group names. The user and
    group list is separated by a blank. For e.g. "alice,bob users,wheel".
    A special value of "*" means all users are allowed.
properties.name: security.inter.tracker.protocol.acl

properties.description:
ACL for JobSubmissionProtocol,used by job clients to
    communciate with the jobtracker for job submission,querying job status etc.
    The ACL is a comma-separated list of user and group names. The user and
    group list is separated by a blank. For e.g. "alice,bob users,wheel".
    A special value of "*" means all users are allowed.
properties.name: security.job.client.protocol.acl

properties.description:
ACL for TaskUmbilicalProtocol,used by the map and reduce
    tasks to communicate with the parent tasktracker.
    The ACL is a comma-separated list of user and group names. The user and
    group list is separated by a blank. For e.g. "alice,bob users,wheel".
    A special value of "*" means all users are allowed.
properties.name: security.job.task.protocol.acl

properties.description:
ACL for NamenodeProtocol,the protocol used by the secondary
    namenode to communicate with the namenode.
    The ACL is a comma-separated list of user and group names. The user and
    group list is separated by a blank. For e.g. "alice,bob users,wheel".
    A special value of "*" means all users are allowed.
properties.name: security.namenode.protocol.acl

properties.description:
ACL for RefreshAuthorizationPolicyProtocol,used by the
    dfsadmin and mradmin commands to refresh the security policy in-effect.
    The ACL is a comma-separated list of user and group names. The user and
    group list is separated by a blank. For e.g. "alice,bob users,wheel".
    A special value of "*" means all users are allowed.
properties.name: security.refresh.policy.protocol.acl

properties.description:
ACL for RefreshUserMappingsProtocol. Used to refresh
    users mappings. The ACL is a comma-separated list of user and
    group names. The user and group list is separated by a blank. For
    e.g. "alice,bob users,wheel".  A special value of "*" means all
    users are allowed.
properties.name: security.refresh.usertogroups.mappings.protocol.acl

properties.description: Database name used as the Hive Metastore
properties.name: ambari.hive.db.schema.name

properties.description:
Whether Hive enable the optimization about converting common
      join into mapjoin based on the input file size.
properties.name: hive.auto.convert.join

properties.description:
Whether Hive enable the optimization about converting common join into mapjoin based on the input file
      size. If this paramater is on,and the sum of size for n-1 of the tables/partitions for a n-way join is smaller than the
      specified size,the join is directly converted to a mapjoin (there is no conditional task).
properties.name: hive.auto.convert.join.noconditionaltask

properties.description:
If hive.auto.convert.join.noconditionaltask is off,this parameter does not take affect. However,if it
      is on,and the sum of size for n-1 of the tables/partitions for a n-way join is smaller than this size,the join is directly
      converted to a mapjoin(there is no conditional task). The default is 10MB.
properties.name: hive.auto.convert.join.noconditionaltask.size

properties.description:
Will the join be automatically converted to a sort-merge join,if the joined tables pass
      the criteria for sort-merge join.
properties.name: hive.auto.convert.sortmerge.join

properties.description: Whether bucketing is enforced. If true,while inserting into the table,bucketing is enforced.
properties.name: hive.enforce.bucketing

properties.description: Whether sorting is enforced. If true,while inserting into the table,sorting is enforced.
properties.name: hive.enforce.sorting

properties.description: Whether to use map-side aggregation in Hive Group By queries.
properties.name: hive.map.aggr

properties.description:
Size per reducer.The default is 1G,i.e if the input size is 10G,it
      will use 10 reducers.
properties.name: hive.mapjoin.bucket.cache.size

properties.description: Whether speculative execution for reducers should be turned on.
properties.name: hive.mapred.reduce.tasks.speculative.execution

properties.description: List of comma separated metastore object types that should be pinned in the cache
properties.name: hive.metastore.cache.pinobjtypes

properties.description: MetaStore Client socket timeout in seconds
properties.name: hive.metastore.client.socket.timeout

properties.description: In unsecure mode,setting this property to true will cause the metastore to execute DFS operations using the client's reported user and group permissions. Note that this property must be set on both the client and     server sides. Further note that its best effort. If client sets its to true and server sets it to false,client setting will be ignored.
properties.name: hive.metastore.execute.setugi

properties.description: URI for client to contact metastore server
properties.name: hive.metastore.uris

properties.description: location of default database for the warehouse
properties.name: hive.metastore.warehouse.dir

properties.description: Whether to enable automatic use of indexes
properties.name: hive.optimize.index.filter

properties.description:
If hive.auto.convert.join is off,this parameter does not take
      affect. If it is on,and if there are map-join jobs followed by a map-reduce
      job (for e.g a group by),each map-only job is merged with the following
      map-reduce job.
properties.name: hive.optimize.mapjoin.mapreduce

properties.description:
Reduce deduplication merges two RSs by moving key/parts/reducer-num of the child RS to parent RS.
      That means if reducer-num of the child RS is fixed (order by or forced bucketing) and small,it can make very slow,single MR.
      The optimization will be disabled if number of reducers is less than specified value.
properties.name: hive.optimize.reducededuplication.min.reducer

properties.description: Hive client authenticator manager class name. The user-defined authenticator class should implement interface org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.security.HiveAuthenticationProvider.
properties.name: hive.security.authenticator.manager

properties.description: enable or disable the hive client authorization
properties.name: hive.security.authorization.enabled

properties.description:
the hive client authorization manager class name.
    The user defined authorization class should implement interface org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.security.authorization.HiveAuthorizationProvider.
properties.name: hive.security.authorization.manager

properties.description: The authorization manager class name to be used in the metastore for authorization. The user-defined authorization class should implement interface org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.security.authorization.HiveMetastoreAuthorizationProvider.
properties.name: hive.security.metastore.authorization.manager

properties.description: controls which SemanticAnalyzerFactory implemenation class is used by CLI
properties.name: hive.semantic.analyzer.factory.impl

properties.description: Driver class name for a JDBC metastore
properties.name: javax.jdo.option.ConnectionDriverName

properties.description: password to use against metastore database
properties.name: javax.jdo.option.ConnectionPassword

properties.description: JDBC connect string for a JDBC metastore
properties.name: javax.jdo.option.ConnectionURL

properties.description: username to use against metastore database
properties.name: javax.jdo.option.ConnectionUserName

properties.default_value: LD_LIBRARY_PATH=/usr/lib/hadoop/lib/native:/usr/lib/hadoop/lib/native/`$JAVA_HOME/bin/java -d32 -version &> /dev/null;if [ $? -eq 0 ]; then echo Linux-i386-32; else echo Linux-amd64-64;fi`
properties.description:
Additional execution environment entries for map and reduce task processes.
      This is not an additive property. You must preserve the original value if
      you want your map and reduce tasks to have access to native libraries (compression,etc)
properties.name: mapreduce.admin.user.env

properties.description:
The maximum number of application attempts. It is a
      application-specific setting. It should not be larger than the global number
      set by resourcemanager. Otherwise,it will be override. The default number is
      set to 2,to allow at least one retry for AM.
properties.name: mapreduce.am.max-attempts

properties.description:
CLASSPATH for MR applications. A comma-separated list of CLASSPATH
      entries.
properties.name: mapreduce.application.classpath

properties.description: Administrators for MapReduce applications.
properties.name: mapreduce.cluster.administrators

properties.description:
The runtime framework for executing MapReduce jobs. Can be one of local,
      classic or yarn.
properties.name: mapreduce.framework.name

properties.description:
Fraction of the number of maps in the job which should be complete before
      reduces are scheduled for the job.
properties.name: mapreduce.job.reduce.slowstart.completedmaps

properties.description: Enter your JobHistoryServer hostname.
properties.name: mapreduce.jobhistory.address

properties.description: Directory where history files are managed by the MR JobHistory Server.
properties.name: mapreduce.jobhistory.done-dir

properties.description: Directory where history files are written by MapReduce jobs.
properties.name: mapreduce.jobhistory.intermediate-done-dir

properties.description: Enter your JobHistoryServer hostname.
properties.name: mapreduce.jobhistory.webapp.address

properties.description: Larger heap-size for child jvms of maps.
properties.name: mapreduce.map.java.opts

properties.description:
The logging level for the map task. The allowed levels are:
      OFF,FATAL,ERROR,WARN,INFO,DEBUG,TRACE and ALL.
properties.name: mapreduce.map.log.level

properties.description: Virtual memory for single Map task
properties.name: mapreduce.map.memory.mb

properties.description:
The soft limit in the serialization buffer. Once reached,a thread will
      begin to spill the contents to disk in the background. Note that
      collection will not block if this threshold is exceeded while a spill
      is already in progress,so spills may be larger than this threshold when
      it is set to less than .5
properties.name: mapreduce.map.sort.spill.percent

properties.description:
If true,then multiple instances of some map tasks
      may be executed in parallel.
properties.name: mapreduce.map.speculative

properties.description: Should the job outputs be compressed?
properties.name: mapreduce.output.fileoutputformat.compress

properties.description:
If the job outputs are to compressed as SequenceFiles,how should
      they be compressed? Should be one of NONE,RECORD or BLOCK.
properties.name: mapreduce.output.fileoutputformat.compress.type

properties.description:
The percentage of memory- relative to the maximum heap size- to
      retain map outputs during the reduce. When the shuffle is concluded,any
      remaining map outputs in memory must consume less than this threshold before
      the reduce can begin.
properties.name: mapreduce.reduce.input.buffer.percent

properties.description: Larger heap-size for child jvms of reduces.
properties.name: mapreduce.reduce.java.opts

properties.description:
The logging level for the reduce task. The allowed levels are:
      OFF,FATAL,ERROR,WARN,INFO,DEBUG,TRACE and ALL.
properties.name: mapreduce.reduce.log.level

properties.description: Virtual memory for single Reduce task
properties.name: mapreduce.reduce.memory.mb

properties.description:
The percentage of memory to be allocated from the maximum heap
      size to storing map outputs during the shuffle.
properties.name: mapreduce.reduce.shuffle.input.buffer.percent

properties.description:
The usage threshold at which an in-memory merge will be
      initiated,expressed as a percentage of the total memory allocated to
      storing in-memory map outputs,as defined by
      mapreduce.reduce.shuffle.input.buffer.percent.
properties.name: mapreduce.reduce.shuffle.merge.percent

properties.description:
The default number of parallel transfers run by reduce during
      the copy(shuffle) phase.
properties.name: mapreduce.reduce.shuffle.parallelcopies

properties.description:
If true,then multiple instances of some reduce tasks may be
      executed in parallel.
properties.name: mapreduce.reduce.speculative

properties.description:
Default port that the ShuffleHandler will run on.
      ShuffleHandler is a service run at the NodeManager to facilitate
      transfers of intermediate Map outputs to requesting Reducers.
properties.name: mapreduce.shuffle.port

properties.description:
The number of streams to merge at once while sorting files.
      This determines the number of open file handles.
properties.name: mapreduce.task.io.sort.factor

properties.description:
The total amount of buffer memory to use while sorting files,in megabytes.
      By default,gives each merge stream 1MB,which should minimize seeks.
properties.name: mapreduce.task.io.sort.mb

properties.description:
The number of milliseconds before a task will be
      terminated if it neither reads an input,writes an output,nor
      updates its status string.
properties.name: mapreduce.task.timeout

properties.description:
Java opts for the MR App Master processes for admin purposes.
      It will appears before the opts set by yarn.app.mapreduce.am.command-opts and
      thus its options can be overridden user.

      Usage of -Djava.library.path can cause programs to no longer function if
      hadoop native libraries are used. These values should instead be set as part
      of LD_LIBRARY_PATH in the map / reduce JVM env using the mapreduce.map.env and
      mapreduce.reduce.env config settings.
properties.name: yarn.app.mapreduce.am.admin-command-opts

properties.description:
Java opts for the MR App Master processes.
      The following symbol,if present,will be interpolated: @taskid@ is replaced
      by current TaskID. Any other occurrences of '@' will go unchanged.
      For example,to enable verbose gc logging to a file named for the taskid in
      /tmp and to set the heap maximum to be a gigabyte,pass a 'value' of:
      -Xmx1024m -verbose:gc -Xloggc:/tmp/@taskid@.gc

      Usage of -Djava.library.path can cause programs to no longer function if
      hadoop native libraries are used. These values should instead be set as part
      of LD_LIBRARY_PATH in the map / reduce JVM env using the mapreduce.map.env and
      mapreduce.reduce.env config settings.
properties.name: yarn.app.mapreduce.am.command-opts

properties.description: MR App Master process log level.
properties.name: yarn.app.mapreduce.am.log.level

properties.description: The amount of memory the MR AppMaster needs.
properties.name: yarn.app.mapreduce.am.resource.mb

properties.description: The staging dir used while submitting jobs.
properties.name: yarn.app.mapreduce.am.staging-dir

properties.description: The mapping from kerberos principal names to local OS user names.
properties.name: oozie.authentication.kerberos.name.rules
oozie.authentication.type

properties.description: Base Oozie URL.
properties.name: oozie.base.url

properties.description: Credential Class to be used for HCat.
properties.name: oozie.credentials.credentialclasses

properties.description: Oozie DataBase Name
properties.name: oozie.db.schema.name

properties.description:
Specifies whether security (user name/admin role) is enabled or not.
     If disabled any user can manage Oozie system and manage any job.
properties.name: oozie.service.AuthorizationService.security.enabled

properties.description:
Maximum concurrency for a given callable type.
     Each command is a callable type (submit,start,run,signal,job,jobs,suspend,resume,etc).
     Each action type is a callable type (Map-Reduce,Pig,SSH,FS,sub-workflow,etc).
     All commands that use action executors (action-start,action-end,action-kill and action-check) use
     the action type as the callable type.
properties.name: oozie.service.CallableQueueService.callable.concurrency

properties.description: Max callable queue size
properties.name: oozie.service.CallableQueueService.queue.size

properties.description: Number of threads used for executing callables
properties.name: oozie.service.CallableQueueService.threads

properties.description:
Comma separated AUTHORITY=HADOOP_CONF_DIR,where AUTHORITY is the HOST:PORT of
          the Hadoop service (JobTracker,HDFS). The wildcard '*' configuration is
          used when there is no exact match for an authority. The HADOOP_CONF_DIR contains
          the relevant Hadoop *-site.xml files. If the path is relative is looked within
          the Oozie configuration directory; though the path can be absolute (i.e. to point
          to Hadoop client conf/ directories in the local filesystem.
properties.name: oozie.service.HadoopAccessorService.hadoop.configurations

properties.description: Whitelisted job tracker for Oozie service.
properties.name: oozie.service.HadoopAccessorService.jobTracker.whitelist
oozie.service.HadoopAccessorService.nameNode.whitelist

properties.description:
Creates Oozie DB.

            If set to true,it creates the DB schema if it does not exist. If the DB schema exists is a NOP.
            If set to false,it does not create the DB schema. If the DB schema does not exist it fails start up.
properties.name: oozie.service.JPAService.create.db.schema

properties.description: JDBC driver class.
properties.name: oozie.service.JPAService.jdbc.driver

properties.description:
DB user password.

            IMPORTANT: if password is emtpy leave a 1 space string,the service trims the value,
                       if empty Configuration assumes it is NULL.
properties.name: oozie.service.JPAService.jdbc.password

properties.description: JDBC URL.
properties.name: oozie.service.JPAService.jdbc.url

properties.description: Database user name to use to connect to the database
properties.name: oozie.service.JPAService.jdbc.username

properties.description: Max number of connections.
properties.name: oozie.service.JPAService.pool.max.active.conn

properties.description: Jobs older than this value,in days,will be purged by the PurgeService.
properties.name: oozie.service.PurgeService.older.than

properties.description: Interval at which the purge service will run,in seconds.
properties.name: oozie.service.PurgeService.purge.interval

properties.description: Enlist the different uri handlers supported for data availability checks.
properties.name: oozie.service.URIHandlerService.uri.handlers

properties.description:
System library path to use for workflow applications.
      This path is added to workflow application if their job properties sets
      the property 'oozie.use.system.libpath' to true.
properties.name: oozie.service.WorkflowAppService.system.libpath

properties.description:
Default timeout for a coordinator action input check (in minutes) for normal job.
      -1 means infinite timeout
properties.name: oozie.service.coord.normal.default.timeout

properties.description: Command re-queue interval for push dependencies (in millisecond).
properties.name: oozie.service.coord.push.check.requeue.interval

properties.default_value:
org.apache.oozie.service.SchedulerService,
        org.apache.oozie.service.InstrumentationService,
        org.apache.oozie.service.CallableQueueService,
        org.apache.oozie.service.UUIDService,
        org.apache.oozie.service.ELService,
        org.apache.oozie.service.AuthorizationService,
        org.apache.oozie.service.UserGroupInformationService,
        org.apache.oozie.service.HadoopAccessorService,
        org.apache.oozie.service.URIHandlerService,
        org.apache.oozie.service.MemoryLocksService,
        org.apache.oozie.service.DagXLogInfoService,
        org.apache.oozie.service.SchemaService,
        org.apache.oozie.service.LiteWorkflowAppService,
        org.apache.oozie.service.JPAService,
        org.apache.oozie.service.StoreService,
        org.apache.oozie.service.CoordinatorStoreService,
        org.apache.oozie.service.SLAStoreService,
        org.apache.oozie.service.DBLiteWorkflowStoreService,
        org.apache.oozie.service.CallbackService,
        org.apache.oozie.service.ActionService,
        org.apache.oozie.service.ActionCheckerService,
        org.apache.oozie.service.RecoveryService,
        org.apache.oozie.service.PurgeService,
        org.apache.oozie.service.CoordinatorEngineService,
        org.apache.oozie.service.BundleEngineService,
        org.apache.oozie.service.DagEngineService,
        org.apache.oozie.service.CoordMaterializeTriggerService,
        org.apache.oozie.service.StatusTransitService,
        org.apache.oozie.service.PauseTransitService,
        org.apache.oozie.service.GroupsService,
        org.apache.oozie.service.ProxyUserService
properties.description: List of Oozie services
properties.name: oozie.services

properties.description:
To add/replace services defined in 'oozie.services' with custom implementations.
       Class names must be separated by commas.
properties.name: oozie.services.ext

properties.description: The Oozie system ID.
properties.name: oozie.system.id

properties.description: System mode for  Oozie at startup.
properties.name: oozie.systemmode

properties.description:
If set to true,submissions of MapReduce and Pig jobs will include
      automatically the system library path,thus not requiring users to
      specify where the Pig JAR files are. Instead,the ones from the system
      library path are used.
properties.name: use.system.libpath.for.mapreduce.and.pig.jobs

properties.description: Time out for templeton api

properties.description: The path to the Hadoop executable.

properties.name: templeton.hcat

properties.description: The path to the Hive archive.
properties.name: templeton.hive.archive

properties.description: The path to the Hive executable.
properties.name: templeton.hive.path

properties.description: The path to the Templeton jar file.
properties.name: templeton.jar

properties.description: Jars to add the the classpath.
properties.name: templeton.libjars

properties.description: Enable the override path in templeton.override.jars
properties.name: templeton.override.enabled

properties.description: The path to the Pig archive.
properties.name: templeton.pig.archive

properties.description: The path to the Pig executable.
properties.name: templeton.pig.path

properties.description: The HTTP port for the main server.
properties.name: templeton.port

properties.description: The class to use as storage
properties.name: templeton.storage.class

properties.description: The hdfs path to the Hadoop streaming jar file.
properties.name: templeton.streaming.jar

properties.description: ZooKeeper servers,as comma separated host:port pairs
properties.name: templeton.zookeeper.hosts

properties.description: Classpath for typical applications.
properties.name: yarn.application.classpath

properties.description: Whether to enable log aggregation
properties.name: yarn.log-aggregation-enable

properties.description:
How long to keep aggregation logs before deleting them. -1 disables.
      Be careful set this too small and you will spam the name node.
properties.name: yarn.log-aggregation.retain-seconds

properties.description: The address of the container manager in the NM.
properties.name: yarn.nodemanager.address

properties.description:
Environment variables that should be forwarded from the NodeManager's
      environment to the container's.
properties.name: yarn.nodemanager.admin-env

properties.description:
Auxilliary services of NodeManager. A valid service name should only contain a-zA-Z0-9_ and can
      not start with numbers
properties.name: yarn.nodemanager.aux-services

properties.description: ContainerExecutor for launching containers
properties.name: yarn.nodemanager.container-executor.class

properties.description:
The interval,in milliseconds,for which the node manager
      waits  between two cycles of monitoring its containers' memory usage.
properties.name: yarn.nodemanager.container-monitor.interval-ms

properties.description:
Number of seconds after an application finishes before the nodemanager's
      DeletionService will delete the application's localized file directory
      and log directory.

      To diagnose Yarn application problems,set this property's value large
      enough (for example,to 600 = 10 minutes) to permit examination of these
      directories. After changing the property's value,you must restart the
      nodemanager in order for it to have an effect.

      The roots of Yarn applications' work directories is configurable with
      the yarn.nodemanager.local-dirs property (see below),and the roots
      of the Yarn applications' log directories is configurable with the
      yarn.nodemanager.log-dirs property (see also below).
properties.name: yarn.nodemanager.delete.debug-delay-sec

properties.description:
The minimum fraction of number of disks to be healthy for the nodemanager
      to launch new containers. This correspond to both
      yarn-nodemanager.local-dirs and yarn.nodemanager.log-dirs. i.e.
      If there are less number of healthy local-dirs (or log-dirs) available,
      then new containers will not be launched on this node.
properties.name: yarn.nodemanager.disk-health-checker.min-healthy-disks

properties.description: Frequency of running node health script.
properties.name: yarn.nodemanager.health-checker.interval-ms

properties.description: Script time out period.
properties.name: yarn.nodemanager.health-checker.script.timeout-ms

properties.description: Unix group of the NodeManager
properties.name: yarn.nodemanager.linux-container-executor.group

properties.description:
List of directories to store localized files in. An
      application's localized file directory will be found in:
      ${yarn.nodemanager.local-dirs}/usercache/${user}/appcache/application_${appid}.
      Individual containers' work directories,called container_${contid},will
      be subdirectories of this.
properties.name: yarn.nodemanager.local-dirs

properties.description: T-file compression types used to compress aggregated logs.
properties.name: yarn.nodemanager.log-aggregation.compression-type

properties.description:
Where to store container logs. An application's localized log directory
      will be found in ${yarn.nodemanager.log-dirs}/application_${appid}.
      Individual containers' log directories will be below this,in directories
      named container_{$contid}. Each container directory will contain the files
      stderr,stdin,and syslog generated by that container.
properties.name: yarn.nodemanager.log-dirs

properties.description:
Time in seconds to retain user logs. Only applicable if
      log aggregation is disabled.
properties.name: yarn.nodemanager.log.retain-second

properties.description:
The remote log dir will be created at
      {yarn.nodemanager.remote-app-log-dir}/${user}/{thisParam}.
properties.name: yarn.nodemanager.remote-app-log-dir-suffix

properties.description:
Amount of physical memory,in MB,that can be allocated
      for containers.
properties.name: yarn.nodemanager.resource.memory-mb

properties.description: Whether virtual memory limits will be enforced for containers.
properties.name: yarn.nodemanager.vmem-check-enabled

properties.description:
Ratio between virtual memory to physical memory when
      setting memory limits for containers. Container allocations are
      expressed in terms of physical memory,and virtual memory usage
      is allowed to exceed this allocation by this ratio.
properties.name: yarn.nodemanager.vmem-pmem-ratio

properties.description:
The address of the applications manager interface in the
      RM.
properties.name: yarn.resourcemanager.address

properties.description: The address of the RM admin interface.
properties.name: yarn.resourcemanager.admin.address

properties.description:
The maximum number of application attempts. It's a global
      setting for all application masters. Each application master can specify
      its individual maximum number of application attempts via the API,but the
      individual number cannot be more than the global upper bound. If it is,
      the resourcemanager will override it. The default number is set to 2,to
      allow at least one retry for AM.
properties.name: yarn.resourcemanager.am.max-attempts

properties.description: The address of the scheduler interface.
properties.name: yarn.resourcemanager.scheduler.address

properties.description: The class to use as the resource scheduler.
properties.name: yarn.resourcemanager.scheduler.class

properties.description: The address of the RM web application.
properties.name: yarn.resourcemanager.webapp.address

properties.description:
The maximum allocation for every container request at the RM,
      in MBs. Memory requests higher than this won't take effect,
      and will get capped to this value.
properties.name: yarn.scheduler.maximum-allocation-mb

properties.description:
TThe minimum allocation for every container request at the RM,
      in MBs. Memory requests lower than this won't take effect,
      and the specified value will get allocated at minimum.
properties.name: yarn.scheduler.minimum-allocation-mb

properties.description:
Maximum percent of resources in the cluster which can be used to run 
      application masters i.e. controls number of concurrent running
      applications.
properties.name: yarn.scheduler.capacity.maximum-am-resource-percent

properties.description: Maximum number of applications that can be pending and running.
properties.name: yarn.scheduler.capacity.maximum-applications

properties.description:
The ACL for who can administer this queue i.e. change sub-queue 
      allocations.
properties.name: yarn.scheduler.capacity.root.acl_administer_queues

properties.description:
The total capacity as a percentage out of 100 for this queue.
      If it has child queues then this includes their capacity as well.
      The child queues capacity should add up to their parent queue's capacity
      or less.
properties.name: yarn.scheduler.capacity.root.capacity

properties.description: Default queue target capacity.

properties.description: The maximum capacity of the default queue.

properties.description: The state of the default queue. State can be one of RUNNING or STOPPED.
properties.name: yarn.scheduler.capacity.root.default.state

properties.description: Default queue user limit a percentage from 0.0 to 1.0.
properties.name: yarn.scheduler.capacity.root.default.user-limit-factor

properties.description: The queues at the this level (root is the root queue).
properties.name: yarn.scheduler.capacity.root.queues

properties.description: No description

properties.description: Ambari admin user name.

properties.description: The password for the initial administrative user.
properties.name: useradmin/default_user_password

properties.description: The default group for hue users.
properties.name: useradmin/default_user_group

properties.description: Enable HDFS NameNode High Availability
properties.name: hdfs.nnha
